definition[0]: a long thin area of something, especially land
example[0]: The bomb had left a swathe of the town centre in ruins.
example[1]: A swathe of sunlight lay across the floor.
definition[1]: a long thin area of grass or plants that has been cut down
example[2]: We cut a swathe through the dense undergrowth.
definition[2]: to wrap or cover something in something
example[4]: The moon was swathed in mist.
